com.example.mdbook

Class UserManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.mdbook.UserManager

  • public class UserManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a singleton interface for managing users, user data and user login / logout. Also provides interface for creating and deleting users. Activities should use userManager instead of going directly through the database controller or the Patient / Caregiver classes. On login, the logged in user object is to be interacted with through the UserController. Relies on DataManager for data lookup and management. Based (partially) off the StudentListManager in the student-picker app by Abram Hindle https://github.com/abramhindle/student-picker
    Version:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Noah Burghardt
    See Also:
    User, UserController, ElasticsearchController

      • getManager

        public static UserManager getManager()
        Returns:
        Singleton instance of self.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if initManager() has not already been called.

      • createPatient

        public Patient createPatient(java.lang.String userID,
                             java.lang.String userPhone,
                             java.lang.String userEmail)
                      throws UserIDNotAvailableException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create new patient profile and save.
        Parameters:
        userID - The unique ID of the new patient. Must be unique.
        userPhone - The phone number of the new patient.
        userEmail - The email of the new patient.
        Throws:
        UserIDNotAvailableException - Thrown if the userID is not unique
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the userID is less than 8 characters

      • createCaregiver

        public Caregiver createCaregiver(java.lang.String userID,
                                 java.lang.String userPhone,
                                 java.lang.String userEmail)
                          throws UserIDNotAvailableException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create new caregiver profile and save.
        Parameters:
        userID - The unique ID of the new caregiver. Must be unique.
        userPhone - The phone number of the new caregiver.
        userEmail - The email of the new caregiver.
        Throws:
        UserIDNotAvailableException - Thrown if the userID is not unique
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the userID is less than 8 characters

      • login

        public boolean login(java.lang.String userid)
        Verify user exists and login credentials are valid. Loads user into UserController on success.
        Parameters:
        userid - The userID of the user trying to log in.
        Returns:
        Returns true on successful login, false if credentials are invalid, user doesn't exist or there is already someone logged in.

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Clears all data out of UserController.

      • fetchUser

        public User fetchUser(java.lang.String userID)
               throws NoSuchUserException
        Builds full user object for the given userID from database. Returns said user object. Does not load into UserController
        Parameters:
        userID - The userID of the user to load.
        Returns:
        A patient or caregiver object built from the userID.
        Throws:
        NoSuchUserException - Thrown if there is no user with the given userID in the database.

      • fetchUserContact

        public ContactUser fetchUserContact(java.lang.String userID)
                             throws NoSuchUserException
        Builds user object containing only userID, phone and email. Returns said user object. Does not load into UserController. Good for showing an overview of a User.
        Parameters:
        userID - The ID of the user to fetch.
        Returns:
        A patient or caregiver object with only the contact information stored.
        Throws:
        NoSuchUserException - Thrown if the userID couldn't be found.

      • saveUser

        public void saveUser(User user)
              throws NoSuchUserException,
                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Take the data in the given user object, find the entry in the database with a matching userID and update the database. Also calls methods to update problem and record data. Anything in database not in user object is removed.
        Parameters:
        user - The user object to be synced into the database.
        Throws:
        NoSuchUserException - Thrown if there is no user with a matching userID already in the database. Shouldn't happen if users are created through the UserManager.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the inputted user is not a (full) patient or caregiver, e.g. a ContactUser.

      • deleteUser

        public void deleteUser(java.lang.String userID)
                throws NoSuchUserException
        Delete all data belonging to the user associated with the given userID from the database. Does not delete patients of caregiver when caregiver is deleted.
        Parameters:
        userID - The userID of the user to be cleared out.
        Throws:
        NoSuchUserException

      • getProblem

        private Problem getProblem(int problemID)
                    throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Assistant method for retrieving full problem objects
        Parameters:
        problemID - The problem ID number
        Returns:
        A fully filled out problem object
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException

      • getRecord

        private Record getRecord(int recordID)
                  throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Assistant method for retrieving full record objects
        Parameters:
        recordID - The record ID number
        Returns:
        A fully filled out problem object
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException

      • setProblem

        private int setProblem(Problem problem)
        Assistant method to saveUser method. Saves Problem data, also calls method to save corresponding record data.
        Parameters:
        problem - The problem object to be uploaded to the database.
        Returns:
        Returns problemID already owned by problem or generated from the DataManager for new problems.

      • setRecord

        private int setRecord(Record record)
        Assistant method to setProblem and saveUser methods. Saves record data.
        Parameters:
        record - The record object to be saved. If it doesn't have an ID already (new record), one will be generated.
        Returns:
        The ID of the record, either the one it already has or a new one generated by the DataManager.

      • deleteProblem

        private void deleteProblem(int problemID)
        Deletes the problem data and associated records and photos from storage.
        Parameters:
        problemID - The ID of the problem to delete.

      • deleteRecord

        private void deleteRecord(int recordID)
        Deletes the record data and associated photos from storage.
        Parameters:
        recordID - The ID of the record to delete.
